page.title: 05Houses around Holbeach Bank
page.content: There is a housing development along Roman Bank filling in all the gaps between the other houses. There are 36 new houses and 53 older ones. Some houses are nearly 200 years old. The new houses have been built on wasteland, allotments or places where old buldings were. Many people say that more people will mean more traffic which is a danger to children. The houses are crowded round the narrow roads so you cannot see the traffic. It is a problem passing parked lorries. Some people say that the new houses do not fit in with the landscape and others say more shops and wider roads will be needed. The new houses are causing problems. People are coming to live here because they have found jobs in the area and because houses are cheaper than in other parts of the country.
